TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PeerTransportElement extends System.ServiceModel.Configuration.BindingElementExtensionElement

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("PeerChannel feature is obsolete and will be removed in the future.", false)

Docs.summary: Specifies a configuration element that causes a channel to transfer messages on the peer transport when it is included in a custom binding. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This configuration element allows you to create a custom binding that implements the peer transport protocol.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void ApplyConfiguration(class System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement bindingElement) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement> whose settings are to be applied to this configuration element.
Docs.summary: Applies the settings of the specified <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement> to this configuration element.
Gets the <xref:System.Type> object that represents the custom binding element.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Type> object that represents the custom binding element.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void CopyFrom(class System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceModelExtensionElement from) cil managed

Docs.param: A that contains the configuration element whose settings are to be copied to this configuration element section.
Docs.summary: Copies the settings from the specified configuration element to this configuration element.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig virtual instance class System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement CreateBindingElement() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a binding element from the settings in this configuration element.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement> whose properties are copied from the settings in this configuration element.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig virtual instance void InitializeFrom(class System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement bindingElement) cil managed

Docs.param: A <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement> to use for initializing this binging configuration instance.
Docs.summary: Initializes this peer transport binding configuration section with the content of the specified binding element.
Gets and sets a configuration element that specifies the IP address upon which the peer transport listens.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Net.IPAddress> that contains the IP address upon which the peer transport listens.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property is not set, or is set to a null reference, the associated <xref:System.ServiceModel.PeerNode> listens on all global addresses (both IPv4 and IPv6) configured for the local machine.

Docs.summary: Gets and sets a configuration element that specifies the maximum size of the TCP message buffer pool, in bytes.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Int64> that specifies the maximum size of the TCP message buffer pool, in bytes. The default value is 524,288 bytes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If you receive more data than you can buffer, the data that exceeds the buffer size remains on the underlying socket until your buffer has room for the rest of the data.

Docs.summary: Gets and sets a configuration element that specifies the maximum size, in bytes, for TCP messages received by the peer binding.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Int64> value that specifies the maximum size in bytes of TCP messages received over the peer channels created by this binding. The default value is 65,536 (64 KB).

Docs.summary: Gets and sets a configuration element that specifies the port for the peer transport binding.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Int32> value that specifies the port for the peer transport binding.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the port value is invalid, <xref:System.ArgumentException> is raised. The default value for this property is 0, which indicates that the listener port is randomly selected from all unreserved ports.

Docs.summary: Gets a instance that contains a collection of objects that can be attributes or objects of this configuration element.
Docs.value: A instance that contains a collection of objects that can be attributes or objects of this configuration element.

Docs.summary: Gets and sets a configuration element that specifies the security to set on peer channels created by this binding.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that indicates the security to set on peer channels created by this binding. Security can be either message- or transport-specific.
